metadata.name: QueryJob
metadata.description:
QueryJob

A Job subclass representing a query operation that may be performed on a Table. A QueryJob instance is created when you call Project#query_job, Dataset#query_job, or View#data.

metadata.name: batch?
metadata.description: Checks if the priority for the query is BATCH.

metadata.name: interactive?
metadata.description: Checks if the priority for the query is INTERACTIVE.

metadata.name: large_results?
metadata.description: Checks if the the query job allows arbitrarily large results at a slight cost to performance.

metadata.name: cache?
metadata.description: Checks if the query job looks for an existing result in the query cache. For more information, see Query Caching.

metadata.name: flatten?
metadata.description: Checks if the query job flattens nested and repeated fields in the query results. The default is true. If the value is false, #large_results? should return true.

metadata.name: cache_hit?
metadata.description: Checks if the query results are from the query cache.

metadata.name: bytes_processed
metadata.description: The number of bytes processed by the query.

metadata.name: destination
metadata.description: The table in which the query results are stored.

metadata.name: query_results
metadata.description: Retrieves the query results for the job.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
bigquery = gcloud.bigquery

q = "SELECT word FROM publicdata:samples.shakespeare"
job = bigquery.query_job q

job.wait_until_done!
data = job.query_results
data.each do |row|
  puts row["word"]
end
data = data.next if data.next?

params.name: token
params.description:
Page token, returned by a previous call,
identifying the result set.

params.name: max
params.description: Maximum number of results to return.

params.name: start
params.description: Zero-based index of the starting row to read.

params.name: timeout
params.description:
How long to wait for the query to complete, in
milliseconds, before returning. Default is 10,000 milliseconds (10
seconds).
